Sentencas: The Nernst-Planck-Poisson (NPP) system of equations is used to study the ion diffusion mechanism in materials, commonly used in storage batteries and solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: An extended finite element method for the Nernst-Planck-Poisson equations

Sentencas: In particular, NPP equations are used to predict the concentration of charged defects and electric potential.
Titulo: An extended finite element method for the Nernst-Planck-Poisson equations

Sentencas: Depending on the size of the computational domain, the distributions exhibit steep gradients near the boundaries.
Titulo: An extended finite element method for the Nernst-Planck-Poisson equations

Sentencas: The traditional finite element method, when employed, requires extremely refined mesh to capture the steep gradient as they employ simple polynomials.
Titulo: An extended finite element method for the Nernst-Planck-Poisson equations

Sentencas: To alleviate the mesh dependence, in this work, we propose to augment the traditional finite element approximation space with a suitable ansatz to capture the steep gradient within the framework of the extended finite element method.
Titulo: An extended finite element method for the Nernst-Planck-Poisson equations

Sentencas: The robustness and the accuracy of the proposed framework is demonstrated by comparing it with an overkill finite element solution.
Titulo: An extended finite element method for the Nernst-Planck-Poisson equations
